review: Dysfunctional Friends | Variety Variety Editions U.S Latino Global Asia Subscribe Today Navigation Menu Film TV Digital Contenders Video Dirt Jobs More Biz Music Legit Scene Conferences Insight Archives Directory Choose Edition U.S Latino Global Asia Russia | My Account Sign In Subscribe HomeFilmReviews Review Dysfunctional Friends John Anderson 0 Share This Article Email LinkedIn Pin It Tumblr February 5 2012 | 0429PM PT A motley collection of twentysomethings has to spend five days and nights together without anyone getting fed up and fleeing. The characters arent the ones the filmmakers should be worried about. With about five more friends than a schematic comedy can comfortably accommodate "Dysfunctional Friends" is about a man who dies and sends his buddies to hell In order to collect their piece of his 13 million estate a motley collection of twentysomethings has to spend five days and nights together without anyone getting fed up and fleeing. The characters arent the ones the filmmakers should be worried about. Dysfunctional Friends In addition to being crowded and overlong the pic is thoroughly unpleasant Its hard to believe the characters -- philandering ad man Brett (Wesley Jonathan) witchy hair stylist Ebony (Reagan Gomez-Preston) porn director Gary (Jason Weaver) washed-up rapper Jamal (Hosea Chanchez) professional sports groupie Storm (Stacy Keibler) et al. -- were ever friends to begin with. Or that once they finish trading insults theyd ever talk again much less stick around for the sequel writer-helmer Corey Grant so obviously sets up. Although none of the actors is given a lot to work with ex-footballer Terrell Owens makes a credible feature debut and Persia White as struggling actress Trenyce delivers a marvelous solo scene talking on her cell. Maybe Moviefone was at the other end. Dysfunctional FriendsProductionA Datari Turner Prods. release and presentation. Produced by Greg Carter Turner. Executive producers Gordon Bijelonic Patrick Thomas Jr. Neil Harrington. Co-producer Chevez Frazier. Directed written by Corey Grant. CrewCamera (color) Richard J. Vialet; editors Ralph Jean-Pierre Datari Turner; music Ira Antelis Jason Grey; music supervisor Kendrick Drack Muse; production designer Rhonda Marie Wagner; costume designer Ca-Trece MasSey. Reviewed at AMC Loews Village 7 New York Feb. 5 2012. Running time 111 MIN. With Stacey Dash Reagan Gomez-Preston Wesley Jonathan Datari Turner Jason Weaver Persia White Terrell Owens Hosea Chanchez Stacy Keibler.
